column4: Ive just tried another mirror, but still no j2re1.4 available...
the RestrictedFormats wiki page covers installing Sun's Java 1.5 which is a much better plan generally
Ive tried that also, but theres also no 'java-package' available... :'(
it does say on the page to enable the other repositories :)
I know, Ive uncommented every repository entry in my sources.list, but still no luck...
and have you edited them to add multiverse?
please read the addingrepositories page ubotu sent you, it really does explain how to do this
you need to have multiverse enabled for each of the entries
So I have to yank-yank and paste every repository entry and add "multiverse" in the end (more or less)?
I can't believe the sources.list from http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/6047 is NOT the default! :o)
Despite the typographical error in "pacakges", of course! ;o)
Just one more question... To turn breezy into dapper all I need is to replace 'breezy' with 'dapper' in sources.list, right?
